intro: Lytoneuron columbinum, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded forest environments.
